coded_answer.p: Thank you very much for your letter. I am very happy to be the winner of the competition and I am looking forward to comecoming to Camp California.

I hope there will be no problem if I travel in July, as this is the only free period I have. FromIn August, in fact, I will start with a new job and I will not be able to liveleave Rome for a long periodtime.
As far as accommodation is concerned, I would prefer to stay in a log cabin, because tents are too hot for me.

I am also pleased to have the chance to do some activities and I would like to choose something I am not able to do so. So, I have decided to chosechoose photography and surfing because I am an absolute beginner at both of them.

Please let me know howwhat is the climate likethe climate is like at the Campcamp, so that I can take with me the right kind of clothes. It would be alsoalso be useful for me to know if there will be someany extra expenses, in order to take enough money for two weeks.
I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Being a woman, I naturally love shopping. It is a really great pleasure going in and out fromof different shops, trytrying on a variety of clothes and shoes, and finally gogoing back home with dozens of bags in your hands.

However, there are a few momentstimes in whichwhen you cannot enjoy shopping. The first one is the Christmas period. Shops are incredibly crowded. You cannot try on a dress and decide to buy it, or not in peace, because outside there is a queue of people waiting for their turn. In many cases, you do not even find the things you want, because the shops run out of products very quickly. Moreover, during this period, prices are usually much higher than in the other month'smonths.

Another situation in which shopping is not enjoyable, is when you go shopping with a man. For the majority of men, in fact, shopping is the most boring activity in the world. A man will try to prevent you from trying more than one dress on and will refuse to stay in the same shop for more than five minutes.
Anyway, apart from these two cases, shopping is always very amusing.
